question:
Given an EL function declared with:

11. <function>
12.   <name>spin</name>
13.  <function-class>com.example.Spinner</function-class>
14.  <function-signature>
15.      java.lang.String.spinIt()
16.  </function-signature>
17. </function>

Which two are true? (Choose two)

options.A:
The function method must have the signature:
  public String spin().
options.C:
The function method must have the signature: 
  public String spinIt().
options.B: The method must be mapped to the logical name "pin" in the web.xml file.
options.E:
The function method must have the signature: 
  public static String spinIt().
options.D:
The function method must have the signature: 
  public static String spin().
options.F: The function class must be named Spinner, and must be in the package com.example.
